normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain News: Vendor Audits Tightened Ahead of Festive Season

unnormalised: Mumbai, India - As the Onam festival approaches, several large Indian manufacturing firms are tightening vendor audit procedures to ensure quality and ethical sourcing. Concerns have been raised regarding the potential for increased production pressures leading to compromised standards.
normalised: Mumbai, India - As the Onam festival approaches, several large Indian manufacturing firms are tightening vendor audit procedures to ensure quality and ethical sourcing. Concerns have been raised regarding the potential for increased production pressures leading to compromised standards.

unnormalised: "We're seeing a renewed focus on robust audits," says Ms. Priya Sharma, Head of Supply Chain at Tata Steel. "Our audits now include unannounced inspections and a deeper dive into labor practices, particularly at smaller units supplying components. We can’t afford to deliver anything less than perfection.”

"Our audits now include unannounced inspections and a deeper dive into labor practices, particularly at smaller units supplying components. We can’t afford to deliver anything less than perfection.”

unnormalised: Recent audits revealed instances of substandard materials and delayed deliveries, costing companies like Bharat Forge an estimated Rs. 5 crores in rework and lost sales.
normalised: Recent audits revealed instances of substandard materials and delayed deliveries, costing companies like Bharat Forge an estimated rupee five crore in rework and lost sales.

unnormalised: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) is hosting a webinar on August 25th focusing on best practices in vendor auditing, highlighting the importance of transparency and collaboration. The discussion will include case studies from companies who have successfully implemented rigorous audit programs. Ensuring the biryani of our supply chain – a delicious and perfect blend of all ingredients – is only possible through diligent monitoring, added Sharma.
